_meta.description: Genre-specific elements for entropy injection and diagnostic reference

wonder.core_promise: Awe and fascination with the unfamiliar or spectacular

scale_revelations: Realizing the small thing is part of something vast
Discovering the structure extends beyond visible horizon
Understanding the true age of what they're seeing
Grasping that what seemed random has pattern
Finding the known universe is a fraction of what exists
Realizing the intelligence behind it is incomprehensible
Seeing the micro and macro mirror each other
Understanding the distance involved is unfathomable
Learning what seemed dead is alive at a different timescale
Discovering the familiar object contains multitudes
Realizing every point in the sky holds the same
Understanding the silence means something larger
Finding that the boundary was an illusion
Learning that what they call ancient is recent in context
discovery_moments: Realization about the nature of reality
Finding evidence of something thought impossible
Seeing something no human has seen before
Finding proof of connection across impossible distance
Realizing what they thought was metaphor was literal
Finding the door that shouldn't exist
Witnessing transformation at the edge of understanding
Receiving knowledge from an impossible source
Understanding the silence was full of meaning
awe_catalysts: Cosmic scale made tangible through comparison
Time depth made visible through remains
Hostile environment revealed as haven for different life
Emptiness revealed as structure too fine to see
Chaos revealed as order at different resolution

idea.core_promise: Intellectual fascination with concepts and their implications

central_concepts: What if memory could be transferred between minds?
What if identity were not continuous but reconstructed?
What if communication altered physical reality?
What if perception determined what exists?
What if time were navigable like space?
What if death were reversible but with limits?
What if consciousness could be copied?
What if lies became physically impossible?
What if intention had measurable weight?
What if privacy no longer existed?
What if humanity could not forget?
What if language determined thought completely?
What if consent could be verified absolutely?
implication_chains: First: who benefits? Then: who loses? Then: who adapts?
Initial adoption leads to unexpected use leads to regulation leads to workaround
Technical limitation becomes social structure becomes identity
Advantage for one creates vulnerability for another creates arms race
Solution creates dependency creates new failure mode
Freedom from X creates requirement for Y
Enhancement of ability reduces tolerance for inability
Removal of limit reveals new limit behind it
What was luxury becomes necessity becomes assumed
What was crime becomes treatment becomes enhancement
What was individual becomes collective becomes infrastructure
What was impossible becomes expensive becomes cheap becomes invisible
What was natural becomes optional becomes quaint
What was sacred becomes technical becomes obsolete
What was human becomes category becomes fluid
testing_scenarios: Edge case that breaks the fundamental assumption
Context where the opposite becomes true
User who uses it as intended but wrongly
Failure that reveals what it depended on
The exception that defines the category
The workaround that becomes the standard
The accident that reveals the design
The protest that becomes the norm
The child who asks the obvious question
The system that routes around the damage

adventure.core_promise: Excitement through physical challenges and journeys

journey_catalysts: Map to something that was thought lost
Message from someone who shouldn't be there
Discovery that something is not where it should be
Call from someone who needs rescue
Opportunity that expires if not seized
Evidence that the destination is real
Failure that can only be fixed elsewhere
Promise made long ago coming due
Competition with rival who departed first
Inheritance that requires presence to claim
Crime that can only be solved at the source
Missing person last seen heading there
obstacle_escalations: Environmental hazard that equipment can handle, then one it can't
Adversary that can be avoided, then one that actively hunts
Supply shortage that causes inconvenience, then one that threatens survival
Passage that is difficult, then one that requires sacrifice to cross
Ally that needs assistance, then one who becomes liability
Information gap that delays, then one that sends them wrong direction
Equipment that functions poorly, then fails completely
Local population that is suspicious, then hostile
Weather that slows progress, then makes it deadly
Navigation error that adds time, then puts them in danger
Creature that is avoidable, then actively territorial
Resource that is scarce, then contested
Path that requires skill, then one that requires sacrifice
Deception that wastes time, then one that wastes resources
Injury that is manageable, then one that changes capabilities
resource_pressures: Water running low with no certain resupply
Medicine needed for injury or illness

horror.core_promise: Dread, fear, and confrontation with the threatening

dread_elements: It was there the whole time
What they thought protected them doesn't
vulnerability_types: Attachment to place or object they cannot leave
Secret that the threat could expose
Skill set useless against this specific threat
Belief system that prevents seeing clearly
Identity tied to confronting rather than fleeing
rule_structures: It can only enter if invited
It cannot cross a particular boundary
It can only take those who are alone
It cannot harm those who do not believe
It is bound to cycles of time
It cannot directly lie but can deceive
It is limited to a specific location
escalation_beats: Second sign shared but not believed
Disappearance or change in someone trusted
Discovery that this has happened before
Realization that it knows about them
Violation of a rule that was supposed to protect
Sacrifice that doesn't work as intended
Survivor who is not what they seem
Moment when it could have ended but didn't

mystery.core_promise: Curiosity about unknown facts through investigation

clues: Missing item that should be present
Reaction that doesn't match the situation
Background detail only expert would notice
Knowledge of something not yet revealed
red_herrings: Person with means but no motive
Character who lies about something unrelated
Suspect with obvious but wrong motive
Obvious solution that doesn't quite fit
Person acting suspiciously for innocent reason
Alibi that's too weak to be fabricated
Motive that exists but wasn't acted on
Timing that suggests but doesn't prove
revelation_structures: Final piece makes all others make sense
Truth was visible from the start, meaning hidden
Witness saw correctly but interpreted wrong
Expert was right but missed the point
The obvious suspect did it, but not the obvious way
investigation_approaches: Re-examine crime scene with new question
Check records no one thought relevant
Find the person no one thought to ask
Look at who benefits from confusion
Find the pattern in the exceptions
Ask why this victim, this time, this place
Look for the door that doesn't fit

thriller.core_promise: Tension through immediate danger and high stakes

ticking_clocks: Cover story about to fall apart
stakes_types: Personal: loved one in direct danger
Professional: career or reputation at risk
Global: many lives depend on outcome
Moral: soul or integrity on the line
Relational: trust that cannot be rebuilt if broken
Physical: body will not recover if failed
Legacy: what gets passed to next generation
Promise: word given that must be kept
Debt: obligation that will be collected
Sacrifice: someone already paid; cannot be wasted
Last chance: no opportunity for retry
power_shifts: Strength becomes weakness in new context
narrow_escapes: Exit appears just as trap closes
Disguise holds for exactly long enough
Distraction works once and won't again
Ally arrives at last possible moment
Plan B succeeds where Plan A failed
Pursuer is delayed by unrelated obstacle
Backup the enemy didn't know about

humor.core_promise: Entertainment through comedy, amusement, and subverted expectations

incongruity_sources: Scale mismatch: cosmic stakes, petty execution
Scale mismatch: petty stakes, heroic execution
Competence mismatch: expert fails at basics
Competence mismatch: amateur succeeds where experts failed
subversion_types: Hero speech delivered to wrong audience
Dramatic reveal no one cares about
Threat that turns out to be harmless
Harmless thing that turns out to be threat
Prophecy fulfilled in literal but useless way
Preparation that addresses every concern but the real one
Expert advice that's technically correct but useless
timing_patterns: Rule of three: setup, reinforce, break
Pause that makes the obvious funnier
Speed that makes the terrible funnier
Repetition that shouldn't still be funny but is
Pattern established then broken at wrong moment
Timing that was perfect but for wrong reason

obstacles: Competing for same position or goal
Bad timing: each ready at different times
External expectations from family or community
History of bad relationships creates walls
connection_progressions: Forced proximity leads to reluctant alliance leads to genuine bond
Misunderstanding leads to clarification leads to deeper understanding
Competition leads to respect leads to collaboration
Distrust leads to testing leads to earned trust
Surface attraction leads to discovered depth leads to commitment
Shared enemy leads to alliance leads to chosen partnership
Obligation leads to care leads to love
Antagonism leads to curiosity leads to appreciation
Mentorship leads to equality leads to friendship
Need leads to dependence leads to interdependence
Projection leads to seeing clearly leads to loving truly
Fear leads to courage for other leads to courage for self
Loneliness leads to company leads to chosen isolation together
Pretense leads to slippage leads to truth
Transaction leads to gift leads to mutual giving
relationship_tests: Success threatens what worked in failure
One changes in way the other doesn't like
Separate paths must be navigated together

difficult_choices: Refusing to choose is a choice
Best choice is one they swore never to make
Easy choice is wrong; hard choice is right
Choice will be judged by people who don't understand
Choice betrays past self to become future self
Choice helps one by hurting another
Choice must be made with incomplete information
Choice must be made under pressure
Choice must be lived with publicly
Choice alienates those who were trusted
transformation_catalysts: Child or student reflects back what was taught
Stranger shows what protagonist could become
Body or circumstance forces new perspective

issue.core_promise: Exploration of social or philosophical questions

issue_approaches: Same character changes position through experience
Personal stakes force abstract into concrete
Victory feels hollow; defeat feels righteous
perspective_types: Victim who still believes in system
complexity_reveals: Ally is right for wrong reasons
Enemy is wrong for right reasons
Success by wrong means is still wrong
Failure by right means is still failure
Who decides matters more than what's decided
Process matters as much as outcome
Both sides are right; both sides are wrong

role_distributions: Old guard, new blood, bridge between
By the book, against the book, writing new book
group_challenges: Trust must be established under time pressure
Loss of one member changes everything
Leadership must be contested then resolved
Resources must be allocated fairly under scarcity
Information must be shared that's dangerous to share
Vulnerability must be admitted to strangers
Past must be processed while present demands action
Each must do what only they can do
dynamic_tensions: Leadership contested between two valid candidates
Past history between members creates friction
What worked before versus what's needed now
When to follow leader versus when to challenge

setting_elements._note: These are setting elements, not elemental genres. Useful for sci-fi and fantasy settings that can house any genre.
scifi_tech_consequences: Someone uses it for purposes never intended
Dependency develops; what happens when it fails?
Changes meaning of fundamental concept (death, identity, privacy)
Religious or ethical movements arise against it
Ruins an existing industry or profession
Changes warfare or crime in unexpected ways
fantasy_magic_costs: Each use makes next easier (addiction risk)
Echoes forward in time (consequences appear later)
Takes away ability to do mundane version
Creates debt that will be collected
Visibility to entities you'd rather not see you
